title: 2 inspectors to depose against DSP Meena
text:
Aneesha Sareen
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 12
In a curious turn to the high-profile case involving suspended UT police DSP RC Meena as an accused in a corruption case, two inspectors, who were earlier posted with the Economic Offences Wing (EOW), have been made prosecution witnesses in the chargesheet against the DSP. The inspectors will now depose in the court against their then immediate supervisor as Meena was heading the EOW when he was arrested. The CBI today filed a 2,000-page chargesheet in the CBI court against DSP Meena (on deputation from Delhi), SI Surinder Kumar and two other persons — Sanjay Dahuja, owner of Berkeley Automobiles, and Aman Grover, owner of KLG Hotel — all of whom were arrested in August this year in a Rs 40 lakh corruption case. Inspector Charanjeet Singh and Inspector Jaswinder Singh of the UT police, who were then posted with the EOW, have been made key prosecution witnesses as per the CBI chargesheet. The chargesheet has been filed under various sections of the Prevention of Corruption Act against all four accused. Inspectors Charanjeet Singh and Jaswinder Singh were involved in conducting raids at various places when the case against CBI complainant Guneet Kaur’s parents was being investigated by the EOW. Both have stated to the CBI that the raids were being conducted at the behest of DSP Meena. The CBI has attached written transcripts of recorded conversations between Aman Grover and complainant Guneet Kaur in which the former is making a direct reference that the bribe amount is meant to be given to DSP Meena. Transcripts of a conversation between accused Sanjay Dahuja and DSP Meena, their meeting at a Sector 26 restaurant corroborated by CCTV footage, all pointing to the Rs 40 lakh deal between them, form part of the chargesheet. The CBI has also attached a cheque for Rs 30 lakh that was paid to accused Aman Grover by the complainant as a bribe. According to the chargesheet, a complaint was received by the CBI from Guneet Kaur alleging that Deepa Duggal had got an FIR registered with the EOW on December 12, 2014, against her (Guneet’s) parents Gurkirpal Singh Chawla and Jagjit Kaur Chawla, and her brother Hamrit Singh Chawla. Aman Grover is the son-in-law of Deepa Duggal and Sanjay Dahuja is his friend. The CBI said Aman Grover contacted Guneet Kaur and informed her that Sanjay Dahuja was in contact with DSP (EOW) Ram Chander Meena and SI Surinder Kumar. Aman Grover further informed that DSP Meena and SI Surinder demanded a bribe of Rs 70 lakh through Sanjay Dahuja for not arresting her parents and brother and to reach a compromise in the case. The CBI stated that Rs 40 lakh was to be paid to the police officials and Rs 30 lakh to Aman Grover to get the matter settled. The CBI laid a trap and recovered Rs 40 lakh and a post-dated cheque for Rs 30 lakh from Aman Grover. The remaining accused were then arrested. After the four were arrested, the CBI had grilled two inspectors — Charanjeet Singh and Jaswinder Singh — then posted with the EOW – to throw more light on the case. Both these inspectors have now been made prosecution witnesses. Some key documents in the chargesheet Transcript of conversation, dated August 12, 2015, between complainant Guneet Kaur, Sanjay Dahuja and Aman Grover. Transcript of conversation between Guneet Kaur and Aman Grover. Transcript of conversation between DSP RC Meena and accused Sanjay Dahuja in which the former is asking for a bribe. List of 30 prosecution witnesses and their statements, including that of Inspector Charanjeet Singh and Inspector Jaswinder Singh. Prosecution sanction received from the Joint Secretary, MHA, dated September 28, 2015, granting sanction to prosecute DSP Meena. Prosecution sanction, dated October 9, received by the UT SSP granting sanction to prosecute SI Surinder Kumar. Copy of complaint, dated August 12, 2015 (two pages), submitted by complainant Guneet Kaur to the CBI. Verification report by the CBI.
